intro: Thujopsis laetevirens, commonly known as the Japanese white pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its slender, pyramidal shape and long, needle-like leaves that are bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, cone-like structures that contain seeds, typical of coniferous species. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental tree in gardens. The botanical features of Thujopsis laetevirens make it an attractive and hardy addition to temperate landscapes.
